TRUE.description: Boolean true value (often represented as 1 or -1 in BASICs).

BLACK.description: Color Black (palette index 0 in standard Next ULA/L2 palettes)

MODE256X192.description: Constant for setting Layer 2 with InitLayer2({MODE})

MODE320X256.description: Constant for setting Layer 2 with InitLayer2({MODE})

MODE640X256.description: Constant for setting Layer 2 with InitLayer2({MODE})

MACHINE_ID_NR_00.description: Identifies TBBlue board type. Should always be 10 (binary 0000 1010) on Next.

NEXT_RESET_NR_02.description: Identifies type of last reset. Can be written to force reset.

ROM_MAPPING_NR_04.description: In config mode, allows RAM to be mapped to ROM area.

PERIPHERAL_1_NR_05.description: Sets joystick mode, video frequency and Scandoubler.

PERIPHERAL_2_NR_06.description: Enables CPU Speed key, DivMMC, Multiface, Mouse and AY audio.

TURBO_CONTROL_NR_07.description: Sets CPU Speed, reads actual speed.

PERIPHERAL_3_NR_08.description: ABC/ACB Stereo, Internal Speaker, SpecDrum, Timex Video Modes, Turbo Sound Next, RAM contention and [un]lock 128k paging.

PERIPHERAL_4_NR_09.description: Sets scanlines, AY mono output, Sprite-id lockstep, reset DivMMC mapram and disable HDMI audio.

PERIPHERAL_5_NR_0A.description: Multiface type, Divmmc automap, Mouse buttons and DPI config.

NEXT_VERSION_MINOR_NR_0E.description: Identifies core (FPGA image) version (sub minor number).

LAYER2_RAM_BANK_NR_12.description: Sets the bank number where Layer 2 video memory begins.

LAYER2_RAM_SHADOW_BANK_NR_13.description: Sets the bank number where the Layer 2 shadow screen begins.

GLOBAL_TRANSPARENCY_NR_14.description: Sets the "transparent" colour for Layer 2, ULA and LoRes pixel data.

SPRITE_CONTROL_NR_15.description: Enables/disables Sprites and Lores Layer, and chooses priority of sprites and Layer 2.

LAYER2_XOFFSET_NR_16.description: Sets the pixel offset used for drawing Layer 2 graphics on the screen.

LAYER2_YOFFSET_NR_17.description: Sets the Y offset used when drawing Layer 2 graphics on the screen.

CLIP_LAYER2_NR_18.description: Sets and reads clip-window for Layer 2.

CLIP_SPRITE_NR_19.description: Sets and reads clip-window for Sprites.

CLIP_ULA_LORES_NR_1A.description: Sets and reads clip-window for ULA/LoRes layer.

CLIP_TILEMAP_NR_1B.description: Sets and reads clip-window for Tilemap.

VIDEO_LINE_MSB_NR_1E.description: Holds the MSB (only, as bit 0) of the raster line currently being drawn.

VIDEO_LINE_LSB_NR_1F.description: Holds the eight LSBs of the raster line currently being drawn.

VIDEO_INTERUPT_CONTROL_NR_22.description: Controls the timing of raster interrupts and the ULA frame interrupt.

VIDEO_INTERUPT_VALUE_NR_23.description: Holds the eight LSBs of the line on which a raster interrupt should occur.

ULA_XOFFSET_NR_26.description: Pixel X offset (0..255) to use when drawing ULA Layer.

ULA_YOFFSET_NR_27.description: Pixel Y offset (0..191) to use when drawing ULA Layer.

HIGH_ADRESS_KEYMAP_NR_28.description: PS/2 Keymap address MSB, read (pending) first byte of palette colour.

HIGH_DATA_TO_KEYMAP_NR_2A.description: High data to PS/2 Keymap (MSB of data in bit 0).

LOW_DATA_TO_KEYMAP_NR_2B.description: Low eight LSBs of PS/2 Keymap data.

DAC_B_MIRROR_NR_2C.description: DAC B mirror, read current I2S left MSB.

DAC_AD_MIRROR_NR_2D.description: SpecDrum port 0xDF / DAC A+D mirror, read current I2S LSB.

DAC_C_MIRROR_NR_2E.description: DAC C mirror, read current I2S right MSB.

TILEMAP_XOFFSET_MSB_NR_2F.description: Sets the pixel offset (two high bits) used for drawing Tilemap graphics on the screen.

TILEMAP_XOFFSET_LSB_NR_30.description: Sets the pixel offset (eight low bits) used for drawing Tilemap graphics on the screen.

TILEMAP_YOFFSET_NR_31.description: Sets the pixel offset used for drawing Tilemap graphics on the screen.

LORES_XOFFSET_NR_32.description: Pixel X offset (0..255) to use when drawing LoRes Layer.

LORES_YOFFSET_NR_33.description: Pixel Y offset (0..191) to use when drawing LoRes Layer.

SPRITE_ATTR_SLOT_SEL_NR_34.description: Selects sprite index 0..127 to be affected by writes to other Sprite ports (and mirrors).

SPRITE_ATTR0_NR_35.description: Nextreg port-mirror to write directly into "byte 1" of Sprite Attribute Upload ($xx57 / 87).

SPRITE_ATTR1_NR_36.description: Nextreg port-mirror to write directly into "byte 2" of Sprite Attribute Upload ($xx57 / 87).

SPRITE_ATTR2_NR_37.description: Nextreg port-mirror to write directly into "byte 3" of Sprite Attribute Upload ($xx57 / 87).

SPRITE_ATTR3_NR_38.description: Nextreg port-mirror to write directly into "byte 4" of Sprite Attribute Upload ($xx57 / 87).

SPRITE_ATTR4_NR_39.description: Nextreg port-mirror to write directly into "byte 5" of Sprite Attribute Upload ($xx57 / 87).

PALETTE_INDEX_NR_40.description: Chooses an palette element (index) to manipulate with.

PALETTE_VALUE_NR_41.description: Use to set/read 8-bit colours of the ULANext palette.

PALETTE_FORMAT_NR_42.description: Specifies mask to extract ink colour from attribute cell value in ULANext mode.

PALETTE_CONTROL_NR_43.description: Enables or disables Enhanced ULA interpretation of attribute values and toggles active palette.

PALETTE_VALUE_9BIT_NR_44.description: Use to set 9-bit (2-byte) colours of the Enhanced ULA palette, or to read second byte of colour.

TRANSPARENCY_FALLBACK_COL_NR_4A.description: 8-bit colour to be used when all layers contain transparent pixel.

MMU0_0000_NR_50.description: Selects the 8k-bank stored in 8k-slot 0 (see Memory map).

MMU1_2000_NR_51.description: Selects the 8k-bank stored in 8k-slot 1 (see Memory map).

MMU2_4000_NR_52.description: Selects the 8k-bank stored in 8k-slot 2 (see Memory map).

MMU3_6000_NR_53.description: Selects the 8k-bank stored in 8k-slot 3 (see Memory map).

MMU4_8000_NR_54.description: Selects the 8k-bank stored in 8k-slot 4 (see Memory map).

MMU5_A000_NR_55.description: Selects the 8k-bank stored in 8k-slot 5 (see Memory map).

MMU6_C000_NR_56.description: Selects the 8k-bank stored in 8k-slot 6 (see Memory map).

MMU7_E000_NR_57.description: Selects the 8k-bank stored in 8k-slot 7 (see Memory map).

COPPER_DATA_NR_60.description: Used to upload code to the Copper.

COPPER_CONTROL_LO_NR_61.description: Holds low byte of Copper control bits.

COPPER_CONTROL_HI_NR_62.description: Holds high byte of Copper control flags.

COPPER_DATA_16B_NR_63.description: Used to upload code to the Copper.

VIDEO_LINE_OFFSET_NR_64.description: Offset numbering of raster lines in copper/interrupt/active register.

ULA_CONTROL_NR_68.description: Disable ULA, controls ULA mixing/blending, enable ULA+.

TILEMAP_DEFAULT_ATTR_NR_6C.description: Default tile attribute for 8-bit only maps.

TILEMAP_BASE_ADR_NR_6E.description: Base address of the 40x32 or 80x32 tile map (similar to text-mode of other computers).

TILEMAP_GFX_ADR_NR_6F.description: Base address of the tiles' graphics.

LAYER2_XOFFSET_MSB_NR_71.description: Sets the pixel offset used for drawing Layer 2 graphics on the screen.

SPRITE_ATTR0_INC_NR_75.description: Same as Sprite port-mirror Attribute 0 Register ($35) (write first byte of sprite-attributes), plus increments Sprite port-mirror Index Register ($34).

SPRITE_ATTR1_INC_NR_76.description: Same as Sprite port-mirror Attribute 1 Register ($36) (write second byte of sprite-attributes), plus increments Sprite port-mirror Index Register ($34).

SPRITE_ATTR2_INC_NR_77.description: Same as Sprite port-mirror Attribute 2 Register ($37) (write third byte of sprite-attributes), plus increments Sprite port-mirror Index Register ($34).

SPRITE_ATTR3_INC_NR_78.description: Same as Sprite port-mirror Attribute 3 Register ($38) (write fourth byte of sprite-attributes), plus increments Sprite port-mirror Index Register ($34).

SPRITE_ATTR4_INC_NR_79.description: Same as Sprite port-mirror Attribute 4 Register ($39) (write fifth byte of sprite-attributes), plus increments Sprite port-mirror Index Register ($34).

EXPANSION_BUS_DECODING_0_NR_86.description: When expansion bus is enabled: Internal ports decoding mask.

EXPANSION_BUS_DECODING_1_NR_87.description: When expansion bus is enabled: Internal ports decoding mask.

EXPANSION_BUS_DECODING_2_NR_88.description: When expansion bus is enabled: Internal ports decoding mask.

EXPANSION_BUS_DECODING_3_NR_89.description: When expansion bus is enabled: Internal ports decoding mask.

EXPANSION_BUS_PROPAGATE_NR_8A.description: Monitoring internal I/O or adding external keyboard.

ALTERNATE_ROM_NR_8C.description: Enable alternate ROM or lock 48k ROM.

PI_GPIO_0_NR_98.description: GPIO pins mapped to Next Register.

PI_PERIPHERALS_ENABLE_NR_A0.description: Enable Pi peripherals: UART, Pi hats, I2C, SPI.

PI_I2S_CLOCK_DIVIDE_REGISTER_NR_A3.description: Pi I2S clock divide in master mode.

EXTENDED_KEYS_0_NR_B0.description: Read Next keyboard compound keys separately.

EXTENDED_KEYS_1_NR_B1.description: Read Next keyboard compound keys separately.

EXTENDED_MD_PAD_BUTTONS_NR_B2.description: Reading additional buttons on MD pads.

DMA_INTERRUPT_ENABLE_1_NR_CD.description: CTC Interrupts that can override DMA.

DMA_INTERRUPT_ENABLE_2_NR_CE.description: UART Interrupts that can override DMA.

DEBUG_LED_CONTROL_NR_FF.description: Turns debug LEDs on and off on TBBlue implementations that have them.
